intro: Mareyopsis, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with opposite leaves and slender stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
